snippet: The move was aimed at building Western support for the rebellion by quelling fears that money would end up in the hands of an group connected to Al Qaeda.
abstract: United States formally designates militant Syrian rebel group Al Nusra Front as foreign terrorist organization; move is aimed at building Western support for rebellion against government of Pres Bashar al-Assad by quelling fears that money and arms meant for rebels will flow to jihadi group.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ANNE BARNARD
byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from Washington and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: The move was aimed at building Western support for the rebellion by quelling fears that money would end up in the hands of an group connected to Al Qaeda.

headline.seo: U.S. Designates Syrian Al Nusra Front as Terrorist Group
headline.main: U.S. Places Militant Syrian Rebel Group on List of Terrorist Organizations
headline.print_headline: U.S. Places Militant Syrian Rebel Group on List of Terrorist Organizations

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
